text: <@U085EKRUJ75> Hopefully this helps  <https://github.com/HubSpot/mobile-chat-sdk-android/blob/main/HubSpot/PushNotifications.md>

<@U07DB91P073> - OK, that seems ok so far. What are the steps you are doing to cause a push message to be sent from the HubSpot side? Creating a chat on the app, then responding to it from your HubSpot inbox?

<@U07DB91P073> Hey, I was taking another look at this config, and you have the topic set as "Life Tools" , it should be the iOS Bundle id.
<@U07ARLLF39N> This might be confusing and worth a rename - I know apple call it topic in their server push documents also, but for front end config, making it more obvious that its the app bundle id would be worthwhile (like com.HubSpot.mobilesdk.HubSpotDemo)
yes, responding to it from your HubSpot inbox
When I send a message from here, the user can't receive the push
Why are there two Chats? Which one should I set up? How should I set up Inboxes and Help Desk?
Can you check if my settings are correct?
The chat function is available now, but the app cannot receive push notifications.
Did you update the topic, not sure if you saw my reply here: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C0736Q81QFQ/p1737015978079339>
It may be a Topic problem, but I don't know what to fill in the Topic input box
See my reply, it should be the app bundle id, as you have it set in xcode & apple developer portal, like `com.company.myapp`  or whatever bundle id is unique to your app.
i will try
thanks
Success
Nice.
I agree, it could be labelled a lot better, I'll see about getting that changed in the future :+1:
Sorry, I wrote it wrong, it is the Bundle ID
All other chat platforms I have integrated have this API, so I hope you can implement it too
Would renaming it "iOS Bundle ID" or "App Bundle ID" make the most sense for this label?
Yes, either of those make the most sense for the label - I'd say App Bundle ID.
FYI, the "Topic" label has been updated to be "App Bundle ID" for U.S. English; other languages should be updated in the coming days.
